fermatOrg.network

Class IoPBlockchain

  • java.lang.Object
    • fermatOrg.network.IoPBlockchain

  • public class IoPBlockchain
extends Object
    Created by rodrigo on 11/3/16. The IoP Blockchain connection. It takes care of finding peers on the IoP blockchain, download pending blocks as they are visible. If we found transactions that belong to any of the watched address, we will store it and trigger the incoming transaction event. Its better (in terms of performance) to only WatchOnlyWallet.connect()to the blockchain after all addresses have already been imported into the wallet with WatchOnlyWallet.importAddresses(File)

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws IoPBlockchainException
        Connects to the blockchain and start downloading missing blocks. * It will try to connect first to any local IoP client, if not found, then it ill connect to remote peers thought DNS discovery. Once all blocks are downloaded it will automatically disconnect.
        Throws:
        IoPBlockchainException - If there is a connection problem

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects from the blockchain network. The connect() methods disconnects automatically after last block has been downloaded from blockchain.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        it notifies if we are connected to the IoP blockchain or not.
        Returns:
        true if we are connected.

      • getBlockchainHeight

        public int getBlockchainHeight()
        returns the amount of blocks we have downloaded from the IoP blockchain
        Returns:
        the amount of blocks we downloaded when this method was called.

      • isSynced

        public boolean isSynced()
        Verifies if we are Synced with the blockchain. A synced blockchain is means that we have the latest block that was broadcasted to the peers we are connected. *
        Returns:
        true if we have all blocks from the blockchain. If false, there might be transactions which we haven't heard off yet.
